keyword: calories in a cheese and ham sandwich
title: Calories in a Cheese and Ham Sandwich
meta_description: Discover calories in a cheese and ham sandwich, including full nutrition breakdown, protein, carbs, fat, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: Calories in a Cheese and Ham Sandwich
assumptions: 2 slices white bread; 50g sliced ham; 30g cheddar cheese; assembled cold, no mayo, butter, or condiments.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by bread type, meat/cheese brands, portion sizes, and additions like spreads. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical cheese and ham sandwich contains about 370 kcal and 20 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use whole wheat bread instead of white

faqs.q: How many calories in a cheese and ham sandwich?
faqs.a: Approximately 370 kcal for a standard version with white bread, ham, and cheddar.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a cheese and ham sandwich?
faqs.a: About 20 g protein, mainly from the ham and cheese.

faqs.q: Does adding mayo increase calories in a cheese and ham sandwich?
faqs.a: Yes, 1 tbsp mayo adds ~90 kcal, making it around 460 kcal total.

faqs.q: Are cheese and ham sandwiches high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, typically ~800 mg due to processed ham and cheese.

faqs.q: How to lower carbs in a cheese and ham sandwich?
faqs.a: Opt for low-carb bread or wrap in lettuce; this can reduce carbs from 40 g to under 10 g.
